paragraphs.body: Book Three: Change (易) is the third and penultimate book of ${link_0}, which ran for a total of thirteen episodes. Set two weeks after the end of ${link_1}, the nomenclature refers to the changes induced by the energy shift of the planet due to ${link_2} and ${link_3}'s battle with the ${link_4}.
paragraphs.text: Book Three: Change (易) is the third and penultimate book of The Legend of Korra, which ran for a total of thirteen episodes. Set two weeks after the end of Book Two: Spirits, the nomenclature refers to the changes induced by the energy shift of the planet due to Harmonic Convergence and Korra's battle with the Dark Avatar.

paragraphs.body: As of May 8, 2014, the animation for Book Three had been completed by ${link_0}. Production work for Book Three was officially completed on June 3, 2014. The book debuted with the first three episodes airing on June 27, 2014. On July 24, it was announced that following the airing of "${link_1}", the remaining five episodes of the book would be moved to online releases, including Nickelodeon's website. The book concluded with the release of the last two episodes on August 22, 2014. Although the last five episodes were shown online exclusively for the book's initial run, they aired alongside the rest of Book Three: Change on Nicktoons starting October 6, 2014. It is followed by ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: As of May 8, 2014, the animation for Book Three had been completed by Studio Mir. Production work for Book Three was officially completed on June 3, 2014. The book debuted with the first three episodes airing on June 27, 2014. On July 24, it was announced that following the airing of "The Terror Within", the remaining five episodes of the book would be moved to online releases, including Nickelodeon's website. The book concluded with the release of the last two episodes on August 22, 2014. Although the last five episodes were shown online exclusively for the book's initial run, they aired alongside the rest of Book Three: Change on Nicktoons starting October 6, 2014. It is followed by Book Four: Balance.

paragraphs.body: Book Three was released on DVD and Blu-ray on December 2, 2014.
paragraphs.text: Book Three was released on DVD and Blu-ray on December 2, 2014.

paragraphs.body: Due to ${link_0} shortening the series' screentime, Book Three episodes were twenty-two minutes long, down from twenty-three minutes as in previous books.
paragraphs.text: Due to Nickelodeon shortening the series' screentime, Book Three episodes were twenty-two minutes long, down from twenty-three minutes as in previous books.

paragraphs.body:
On June 8, 2014, episodes three through six of Book Three were accidentally leaked on the Mexican Nickelodeon website, MundoNick.
 The leaked episodes prompted the production team to release an official trailer for the third book on June 11, earlier than originally planned.
paragraphs.text:
On June 8, 2014, episodes three through six of Book Three were accidentally leaked on the Mexican Nickelodeon website, MundoNick.
 The leaked episodes prompted the production team to release an official trailer for the third book on June 11, earlier than originally planned.

paragraphs.body: The leaked episodes prompted the production team to release an official trailer for the third book on June 11, earlier than originally planned.
paragraphs.text: The leaked episodes prompted the production team to release an official trailer for the third book on June 11, earlier than originally planned.

paragraphs.body: On August 7, 2014, the tenth episode of Book Three was leaked as well.
paragraphs.text: On August 7, 2014, the tenth episode of Book Three was leaked as well.

paragraphs.body: Book Three: Change ends with the ${link_0} substantially wounded, much like ${link_1} of the ${link_2}. It also parallels ${link_3} in the fact that both end with a ceremony and the imprisonment of the primary antagonists.
paragraphs.text: Book Three: Change ends with the Avatar substantially wounded, much like Book Two: Earth of the original series. It also parallels Book Three: Fire in the fact that both end with a ceremony and the imprisonment of the primary antagonists.

paragraphs.body: This was the first book in the franchise in which neither ${link_0} nor ${link_1} appeared.
paragraphs.text: This was the first book in the franchise in which neither Katara nor Aang appeared.

paragraphs.body: The book both starts and ends two weeks after the resolution of a major event: the defeat of UnaVaatu and the defeat and imprisonment of Zaheer, respectively.
paragraphs.text: The book both starts and ends two weeks after the resolution of a major event: the defeat of UnaVaatu and the defeat and imprisonment of Zaheer, respectively.

paragraphs.body: This is the only book of The Legend of Korra in which the final battle did not take place in ${link_0}.
paragraphs.text: This is the only book of The Legend of Korra in which the final battle did not take place in Republic City.
